comment.author: 52882109@N07
comment._content: This article mentions a Navy Captain Cyril T. Simard (2nd from left?) at Midway in WW2. www.history.navy.mil/photos/events/wwii-pac/midway/mid-1a...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A Lt. B. H. Wyatt, USN, is mentioned being the commander of a surveying detachment working in Alaska in the 1920s (but the work seems to have been based in San Diego?), on page 47 of the self-published: Wayne H. Heiser, US Naval and Marine Corps Reserve Aviation, Volume 1, 1916-1942 Chronology(2004). He seems to be Lt. Ben H. Wyatt: utron1.itgo.com/the_survey.htm Navy Commodore Ben H. Wyatt was later US military governor of the Marshall Islands, during "Operation Crossroads," a series of nuclear tests at Bikini Atoll, 1946: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossroads
